connector.description:
Send data to AWS DynamoDB service. The sent data will insert/update/delete an item on the given AWS DynamoDB table.

Access Key/Secret Key are the basic method for authenticating to the AWS DynamoDB service. These parameters are optional, because the Kamelet provide also the 'useDefaultCredentialsProvider'.

When using a default Credentials Provider the AWS DynamoDB client will load the credentials through this provider and won't use the static credential. This is reason for not having the access key and secret key as mandatory parameter for this Kamelet.

This Kamelet expects a JSON as body. The mapping between the JSON fields and table attribute values is done by key, so if you have the input:

'{"username":"oscerd", "city":"Rome"}'

The Kamelet will insert/update an item in the given AWS DynamoDB table and set the attributes 'username' and 'city' respectively. Please note that the JSON object must include the primary key values that define the item.

camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-sink.table.name: camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-sink.table
camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-sink.table.description: Name of the DynamoDB table to look at

camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-sink.accessKey.name: camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-sink.accessKey
camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-sink.accessKey.description: The access key obtained from AWS

camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-sink.secretKey.name: camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-sink.secretKey
camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-sink.secretKey.description: The secret key obtained from AWS

camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-sink.region.name: camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-sink.region
camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-sink.region.description: The AWS region to connect to Example: eu-west-1

camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-sink.operation.name: camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-sink.operation
camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-sink.operation.description: The operation to perform (one of PutItem, UpdateItem, DeleteItem) Example: PutItem

camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-sink.writeCapacity.name: camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-sink.writeCapacity
camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-sink.writeCapacity.description: The provisioned throughput to reserved for writing resources to your table

camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-sink.useDefaultCre.name: camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-sink.useDefaultCredentialsProvider
camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-sink.useDefaultCre.description: Set whether the DynamoDB client should expect to load credentials through a default credentials provider or to expect static credentials to be passed in.

camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-sink.uriEndpointOv.name: camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-sink.uriEndpointOverride
camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-sink.uriEndpointOv.description: Set the overriding endpoint URI. This option needs to be used in combination with overrideEndpoint option.

camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-sink.overrideEndpo.name: camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-sink.overrideEndpoint
camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-sink.overrideEndpo.description: Set the need for overiding the endpoint URI. This option needs to be used in combination with uriEndpointOverride setting.
